result.execSummary:
The defendant Michele D. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michele D. Moore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michele D. Moore was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs which includes the Domestic Abuse Surcharge and DNA Surcharge 
*Cash bond to be applied to fines/costs 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Maintain full-time employment during period of supervision
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*No violent or abusive contact with Jerold Filtz
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations as recommended by the Agent

Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michele D. Moore in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Michele D. Moore in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:01 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing
Court questions the parties if the noticed any thing incorrect on the revocation packet; no corrections or changes by either party

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
52 days jail credit
Time served jail sentence
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michele D. Moore in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:20 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will be pleading to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.Cash bond may be applied against the fine and costs. Defense is free to argue. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty
Count 2: Dismissed

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Atty Sheets provides a letter to the Court and Prosecutor.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 6 Months
Conditions:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations as recommended by the agent
Maintain full time employment during period of supervision
No violent or abusive contact with Jerold Filtz
Pay court costs
Pay domestic abuse surcharge
Pay DNA surcharge

Cash bond is to be applied to fine/costs
